Detested by commoners and nobles alike, for it was always watching. The workmen adored it, however. The bell became a sign of good luck for them and an assurance that help would surely come should the tunnels give way.
tapestrylore-schematic-c: 9. Schematic C “A mobile colossus for scaffold and hoisting. May they inspire our tired workmen” When they first started moving, the crowds almost panicked and fled. But eventually a cheer went up. Finally we had made something greater than ourselves.
tapestrylore-schematic-d: 10. Schematic D “With the prima materia, all is possible” I’ll never know how he found it, but that discovery changed everything. We became sorcerers. Miracle workers. An essence, long theorized, that opened up the possibility of heaven on earth.
tapestrylore-rotbeast: 11. Rot beast I’d heard rumors of these creatures, back then. When the sickness reached the brain, it sometimes led to extended bouts of madness; a patient in the lazar house might suddenly rage against those around them. In the case of beasts, it led to these wandering monstrosities: Skin sloughing off, full of rage and fear, they mindlessly attacked anything around them. Naturally, any survivors of such an onslaught were likely to contract the Rot as well.
tapestrylore-seraphim: 12. Seraphim To think we would have a chance to fight again. I do not know why we are returned to this world, but I am grateful.
tapestrylore-blackguard: 13. Blackguard Map They were a grim lot with a heavy burden: to uphold some semblance of order in the depths. This looks like a strategist’s map. It reveals a section of the tunnels, covered in symbols and etchings. Each one marks a cache of water, a hidden guardpost, or suspected rebels.
tapestrylore-forlorn: 14. Banner of the Forlorn Hope They declared themselves the vanguard. Swords raised, oaths taken; they swore a heavenly charge against our foe. It was a challenge of will and ingenuity.
tapestrylore-gate: 15. Holding the Gate The last great battle of our time was fought not between two belligerent nations, only two desperate remnants of humanity. Those who desperately sought entrance and those who must deny them. Rot amongst the besiegers; soon rot amongst the besieged. The knights rode out one last time and were dragged from their saddles.
tapestrylore-diet: 16. Diet of Kings How they must have quaked then. All those crowned heads with eyes wide and furrowed brows. Asked by a mere scholar to cast aside the endless work and slaughter of their forefathers. The hoards of wealth and banners. And yet, case aside they did.
tapestrylore-oldworld: 17. The Old World Paupers and kings; craftsmen, soldiers, and clergy. All petty distinctions in the face of oblivion.
tapestrylore-temporality: 18. Dangers of Temporality In private he spoke of a world unhinged. Unbound by the geas of reality. “It is a place of wonders, my friends. And yet, I ask for caution — lest we see our own world changed in kind.”

characterdesc-commoner:
Leave behind your old life. Crawl into the new world.

Commoners are generalists from a multitude of backgrounds. While they have no defining skills or strengths to speak of, they also lack the weaknesses of those who specialize.
characterdesc-hunter:
Loose the arrow, kill the beast. Take it home to your dying child. Eventually your child will die and you’ll find yourself providing for someone else’s dying child.

Hunters are ranged specialists that excel in the wild forests, plains, and mountains. They struggle in the confined tunnels of the underground.
characterdesc-malefactor:
Terrible things are done in the heart of despair.
She is gone, but you remain.

Malefactors are tenacious survivors who can avoid unwanted attention and find loot that others might have missed. A heavy conscience leads to weakness in combat, however.
characterdesc-clockmaker:
The machines never stop ticking down there. You’ve seen to that.
You can hear them in your sleep.

Clockmakers are masters of precision and systems. They can easily dismantle or repair machinery, but they have no stomach for violence.
characterdesc-blackguard:
Fight if you must. Kill if you must. Don’t look away.
A hard gaze on life will see you through.

Blackguards are fierce soldiers that thrive in a close-ranged skirmish, but a life of conflict has its downsides: They have no talent for delicate work and need more food to maintain their strength.
characterdesc-tailor:
Make a fitting garb, so we may walk with grace once more.

Tailors provide stylish clothes and clothing repairs to stay warm during the winter months. A lifetime spent in the city leaves them ill-prepared for some hardships of nature.

handbook-pitkiln-createdby:
Place clay products in a 1x1x1 hole, then place หญ้าแห้ง, sticks and firewood. Peat and coal can also be used instead of firewood. Ignite to fire your clay products. Careful, ignites nearby combustible blocks.

A pit kiln fueled with firewood will take 24 hours to finish. Peat will take 16 hours, brown/ถ่านหินดำ 12 hours, and charcoal 10 hours.

Off Disables rifts and surface drifters Invisible Rifts spawn drifters, but are invisible, do not affect your temporal stability and make no sound Visible Rifts spawn drifters, can be seen, emit sounds and affect your temporal stability

tutorial-firststeps-1: Use {0} {1} {2} {3} keys to move around. Use your mouse to look around. Use {4} to jump and {5} to sneak. Hold {6} and {0} to sprint.
tutorial-firststeps-2:
Hold {0} to release your mouse cursor. With this you can click on links.
Click here to continue
tutorial-firststeps-3: Use {0} to open your inventory and {1} to go to your Character inventory. You can use the Esc key to close inventories
tutorial-firststeps-4: เชิร์ต|stone-granite|stone-peridotite|stone-แอนดีไซต์|stone-basalt|stone-obsidian</itemstack> knappable stones found loosely on the ground. Collect them using <icon>rightmousebutton</icon> or <icon>leftmousebutton</icon>
tutorial-firststeps-5: Nice! Now find {0} <itemstack type="item">stick</itemstack> sticks, found on the ground in forests or when breaking leaves with branches inside.
tutorial-firststeps-6: เชิร์ต|knifeblade-granite|knifeblade-peridotite|knifeblade-แอนดีไซต์|knifeblade-basalt|knifeblade-obsidian with the knapping system. shift + rightmousebutton on the ground with a knappable stone in hands to begin. Then shift + rightmousebutton again with the second stone, choose ใบมีดthe shape, and tap it out!
tutorial-firststeps-7: เชิร์ต|knife-generic-granite|knife-generic-peridotite|knife-generic-แอนดีไซต์|knife-generic-basalt|knife-generic-obsidian knife in your 3x3 crafting grid. Use the handbook (open with handbook) to look up the recipe.
tutorial-firststeps-8: Welcome to the Stone Age! With your knife in hands, hold <icon>leftmousebutton</icon> to harvest {0} <itemstack type="item">papyrustops|cattailtops</itemstack> from <itemstack type="block">tallplant-coopersreed-land-normal-free|tallplant-papyrus-land-normal-free</itemstack> cattails or papyrus
tutorial-firststeps-9: Storage time! Using 10 reeds or papyrus, craft a basket basket. To equip the basket, place it in one of the 4 special slots on the right of your inventory (inventorydialog). Ultimately you'll probably want to have 4 of them.
tutorial-firststeps-10: Don't forget about food! Collect {0} berries, เห็ดs, wild crops or other edibles. Harvest berries with <icon>rightmousebutton</icon>
tutorial-firststeps-11: Time to invent fire! Craft an axe. Use 2 knappable stones to make an axe head, then craft an axe from the axe head combined with a stick.
tutorial-firststeps-12: With your axe in hands, chop down a small tree by holding <icon>leftmousebutton</icon>. Chop the base of the tree and eventually the whole tree will fall. Collect {0} logs.
tutorial-firststeps-13: Way to go, you lumberjack! Let's turn that into firewood. Use the logs and axe to craft {0} firewood firewood in your inventory.
tutorial-firststeps-14: We also need tinder. With your knife in hands, cut some grass to collect {0} หญ้าแห้ง.
tutorial-firststeps-15: With the หญ้าแห้ง in your hands, hold <hk>shift</hk> + <icon>rightmousebutton</icon> while aiming at the ground to place the tinder for your firepit.
tutorial-firststeps-16: Add 4 firewood to your firepit with <icon>rightmousebutton</icon>.
tutorial-firststeps-18: With the fire starter in hands, use <hk>shift</hk> + <icon>rightmousebutton</icon> on the firepit to ignite it. It might take a couple of tries...
tutorial-firststeps-19:
You have discovered fire! \o/
Use it to create torches and to roast meat or cattail roots, or to make meals. Craft a torch-basic-extinct-up torch next.
tutorial-firststeps-20: Place the torch in the cooking slot of your firepit and give it a couple of seconds. Pick up a <itemstack type="block">torch-basic-lit-up</itemstack> lit torch from your firepit.
tutorial-firststeps-21: Congratulations! Now you know the basics of Vintage Story. This starter tutorial is concluded. For your next steps, check out the Starter Guide and Progression Guide

worldattribute-landformScale-desc:
Landforms are the principal mechanic that shape the terrain. They are what determine where are lakes, mountains, hills, flat lands, cliffs,... how common they are, and (optionally) in what climate they can occur.
An increased landform scale means the same landform will occupy a larger area. In other words, you will encounter wider mountains, wider lakes, wider flat lands, etc.

setting-hover-instabilityWavingStrength: Determines the intensity of the waviness during low temporal stability situations

item-handbooktext-creature-goat-ibexnub-: Nubian Ibex are an equatorial goat, that prefers hot and dry climates, with little to no forest cover.  They also prefer lower elevations than most other goats.
item-handbooktext-creature-goat-valais-*: Valais goats are a temperate climate goat.  They dislike excessively rainy areas, and areas of heavy forest. But unlike most goats, they are more comfortable at less extreme elevations.
item-handbooktext-creature-goat-takingol: ทอง takin are a type of goat that prefers moderately high mountains and badlands. They dislike forests, but do not mind wet climates, unlike most other goats.
item-handbooktext-creature-goat-turdag-*: Tur are a type of goat that prefers moderate to high mountains. They dislike forests, but do not mind wet climates, unlike most other goats.
item-handbooktext-creature-goat-muskox-*: Musk oxen are a type of goat (despite their name).  They are found in arctic regions, and unlike most goats can be found at low elevations.  They dislike regions of high precipitation, or extremely heavy forest.
item-handbooktext-creature-goat-nubian-*: Nubian goats are a tropical climate goat that can be found at low elevations, unlike most goats. They like dry climates, with low amounts of forest cover.
item-handbooktext-creature-goat-sirohi-*: Sirohi goats are a tropical climate goat that can be found at low elevations, unlike most goats. They are more tolerant of rain than their Nubian cousins, but still do not like extremely high levels of rain. Like most goats, they dislike heavy forest cover.
item-handbooktext-creature-goat-*: Goats are typically found in rough terrain, well above sea level. In general, they avoid overly rainy climates, and forests.
setting-hover-togglesprint: Additionally allows double tab forward to activate sprint
worldattribute-caveIns-desc: Causes unstable rock to collapse when mined

Ok new claim initiated, use /land claim: Ok new claim initiated, use /land claim start, then /land claim end to mark an area, you can use /land claim grow [up|north|east|...] [size] to grow/shrink the selection, if you messed up use /land claim cancel, then finally /land claim add to add that area. You can add multiple areas as long as they are adjacent. Once all is ready, use /land claim save [text] to save the claim
